answers.answer: Hello,Hypoglycemia in newborn babies is commonly seen in large for gestational age babies that is babies of mothers with diabetes mellitus, inadequate maternal nutrition in pregnancy ,severe hemolytic disease of the newborn, birth defects and congenital metabolic diseases ,birth asphyxia, liver disease etc.Hypoglycaemia needs to be treated immediately otherwise it can result in seizures and brain damage in the newborn.Colostrum is rich in antibodies and immunoglobulins.Colostrum is low in fat since newborns do not have ability to digest fats. It is easily digestible. It would be really helpful if you write to us with more details about the inability to break down colostrum.I do hope it helps.Take care and regards!
